news.headline: Optimism around Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT) delivering new earnings growth may be shrinking as stock declines 11% this past week
news.article_text: The simplest way to benefit from a rising market is to buy an index fund. Active investors aim to buy stocks that vastly outperform the market - but in the process, they risk under-performance. That downside risk was realized by Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT) shareholders over the last year, as the share price declined 16%. That falls noticeably short of the market return of around 17%. At least the damage isn't so bad if you look at the last three years, since the stock is down 0.9% in that tim

news.headline: Evercore ISI Says Abbott’s (ABT) Core Growth Drivers Are Still Intact
news.article_text:
Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT) is included among the 12 Most Profitable Dividend Stocks to Buy in 2026.

Evercore ISI Says Abbott’s (ABT) Core Growth Drivers Are Still Intact

Courtesy of Abbott Labs

On January 23, Evercore ISI trimmed its price target on Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT) to $138 from $144. However, it kept an Outperform rating. news.headline: Abbott Laboratories (ABT) Is a Trending Stock: Facts to Know Before Betting on It
news.article_text:
Abbott (ABT) has been one of the most searched-for stocks on Zacks.com lately. So, you might want to look at some of the facts that could shape the stock's performance in the near term.

Shares of this maker of infant formula, medical devices and drugs have returned -14% over the past month versus the Zacks S&P 500 composite's +0.2% change. news.headline: 3 Reasons to Buy This Dividend King After Its Steep Sell-Off
news.article_text:
Investors' reaction to this Dividend King's Q4 revenue miss was overdone.

Abbott Laboratories (ABT 0.46%) announced its 2025 fourth-quarter and full-year results before the market opened on Thursday, Jan. 22, 2026. And its shares promptly plunged nearly 10%. As you probably figured out from that brief overview, investors didn't like the healthcare giant's Q4 update.

buys.news_summary: UnitedHealth, Humana, CVS Shares Get Crushed As Trump Administration Proposes Lower-Than-Expected Medicare Insurer Rates.

news.headline: UnitedHealth stock plunges, leads insurers lower after Trump Medicare spending plan surprise
news.article_text:
The health insurance sector saw a deep sell-off Tuesday, led by a plunge in UnitedHealth Group (UNH) shares, as the Trump administration proposed a lower-than-expected increase to 2027 Medicare Advantage plans.

In a report published Monday night by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), the administration proposed that payment rates for Medicare Advantage plans (private insurance plans) will rise by just 0.09% in 2027. Analysts were expecting an increase of as much as 6%.

UnitedHe

news.headline: UnitedHealth, Humana, CVS Shares Get Crushed As Trump Administration Proposes Lower-Than-Expected Medicare Insurer Rates
news.article_text:
Health insurer stocks are tumbling after the market close on Monday following a report indicating the Trump administration will propose essentially unchanged rates for Medicare insurers next year.

Roughly Flat Rates Report Hits Medicare Insurers

The Trump administration reportedly plans to propose “roughly flat” rates for Medicare insurers in 2027, setting up payments to plans to increase by approximately 0.09% next year, according to The Wall Street Journal.

Don't Miss:

news.headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Medicare Disadvantage
news.summary: The health-insurance sector crumbled on Tuesday on news the Trump administration wants to hold Medicare rates almost flat next year.  Shares in Humana closed down 21%, while UnitedHealth plunged 20% and CVS declined 14%.  The Wall Street Journal reported that the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services proposed to hold payment rates to an average .09% increase next year, far below what the companies and Wall Street had expected.

news.headline: Health Insurers in Shock After Medicare Holds Line on 2027 Payments
news.summary: Big companies lost $96 billion in market capitalization after Medicare proposed a relatively flat rate increase for next year.

news.headline: Mastercard (MA) To Report Earnings Tomorrow: Here Is What To Expect
news.article_text:
Global payments technology company Mastercard (NYSE:MA) will be reporting results this Thursday before market hours. Here’s what investors should know.

Mastercard beat analysts’ revenue expectations by 0.8% last quarter, reporting revenues of $8.60 billion, up 16.7% year on year. It was a mixed quarter for the company, with but .

news.article_text:

news.headline: Is Mastercard Stock a Smart Bet Ahead of Q4 Earnings? Key Estimates
news.article_text:
Payments giant Mastercard Incorporated MA is set to report fourth-quarter 2025 results on Jan. 29, 2026, before the opening bell. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for the to-be-reported quarter’s earnings is currently pegged at $4.20 per shareon revenues of $8.74 billion.
